TITLE: 71 of Our Favorite Facts of 2022
SUMMARY: Each day, Inside The Times Times Insider editors scour the newspaper for the most interesting facts to appear in articles. Here are facts that surprised, enlightened or entertained us this year.

TITLE: How Genital Stingers Give Male Wasps Some Sexual Equality
SUMMARY: A study that involved giving frogs an unpleasant snack has shown that male wasps really can defend themselves with jabs from their genitalia.

TITLE: How to Prevent Shoulder Injury
SUMMARY: Shoulder pain can make your days more challenging and keep you up at night. Ward it off with a few smart exercise habits.

TITLE: Why Am I So Bloated? How to Find Relief
SUMMARY: And is there anything I can do about it?

TITLE: Why Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder Gets Overlooked
SUMMARY: Experts say millions of people are affected by trauma, which has become a buzzword and a meme. So why aren’t more of them being treated?

TITLE: How to Exercise Mindfully
SUMMARY: Bringing meditation into your movement can enrich your workout and help you feel clearheaded afterward.

TITLE: How Do I Get My Sex Drive Back?
SUMMARY: Advice on how to restore a decline in sexual desire.

TITLE: Does Dairy Cause Acne?
SUMMARY: Maybe, experts say, but the science is mixed.

TITLE: New York Republican George Santos’s Résumé Called Into Question
SUMMARY: Mr. Santos, a Republican from New York, says he’s the “embodiment of the American dream.” But he seems to have misrepresented a number of his career highlights.

TITLE: Can Cold Water Plunges Really Reduce Anxiety and Depression?
SUMMARY: Early research suggests this age-old practice might benefit mental health, but more research is needed.

TITLE: How to Do Squats Correctly
SUMMARY: It’s the one exercise most of us should be doing. But we need to do it right.

TITLE: What is ‘Task Paralysis’? And How to Overcome it

SUMMARY: Despair in the winter months can point to a serious condition. Experts recommend light boxes, earlier wake-up times and therapy.

SUMMARY: Times Opinion wants to hear from Europeans: How are you coping with increasing energy costs?

TITLE: My Dog’s Death Taught Me Spiritual Detachment. Then My Sister Got Sick.
SUMMARY: When she got cancer, she started joking about life without her. I was not amused.

TITLE: Medication Abortions Are Increasing: What They Are and Where Women Get Them
SUMMARY: Most abortions overseas involve pills, and the method is used in about half of legal U.S. abortions. It also seems to be the future of illicit abortion.

TITLE: What to Know About Tucker Carlson’s Rise
SUMMARY: A Times examination of the host’s career and singular influence at Fox News shows how his trajectory traces the transformation of American conservatism itself.

TITLE: How Tucker Carlson Stoked White Fear to Conquer Cable
SUMMARY: A string of setbacks made the pundit flee television, the Republican establishment and even his home. He re-emerged with what may be the most racist, and successful, show in the history of cable news.

TITLE: New York Republican George Santos’s Résumé Called Into Question
SUMMARY: Mr. Santos, a Republican from New York, says he’s the “embodiment of the American dream.” But he seems to have misrepresented a number of his career highlights.

TITLE: Death in Navy SEAL Training Exposes a Culture of Brutality, Cheating and Drugs
SUMMARY: The elite force’s selection course is so punishing that few make it through, and many of those who do resort to illicit tactics.

TITLE: Early Cormac McCarthy Interviews Rediscovered
SUMMARY: The Pulitzer Prize-winning author has done vanishingly few interviews during the course of his career. In these early ones, some newly uncovered, he is less guarded.

TITLE: What Is a Heat Dome?
SUMMARY: A heat dome is a high pressure system way up in the atmosphere that helps create and encase heat, kind of like a lid on a pot that holds in steam, or a soda bottle cap that traps in gas.

TITLE: Overlooked No More: Theresa Hak Kyung Cha, Artist and Author Who Explored Identity
SUMMARY: She was murdered after the publication of her first novel, “Dictee,” a challenging exploration of Korean history and immigrant life that inspires Asian American writers today.

TITLE: How the Proud Boys Breached the Capitol on Jan. 6: Rile Up the Normies
SUMMARY: A Times investigation of court documents, text messages and hundreds of videos shows how the Proud Boys coordinated to instigate multiple breaches of the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6.

TITLE: Can Coco Gauff the Tennis Prodigy Become a Tennis Legend?
SUMMARY: Since Coco Gauff went pro at 14, she has played under the weight of high expectations. Now 18, she has her own measures for greatness.

TITLE: How The mRNA Vaccines Were Made: Halting Progress and Happy Accidents
SUMMARY: The stunning Covid vaccines manufactured by Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna drew upon long-buried discoveries made in the hopes of ending past epidemics.

SUMMARY: On the day the Capitol was attacked, 139 Republicans in the House voted to dispute the Electoral College count. This is how they got there.
